ZT2Strings.LOC_STRING:
Bottlenose Dolphin
Click to select and then place a bottlenose dolphin, a gregarious marine mammal. The bottlenose dolphin can perform in shows.

Manta Ray
Click to select and then place a manta ray, a graceful, ocean-dwelling ray.

Orca
Click to select and then place an orca, the largest member of the cetacean family. The orca can perform in shows.

Green Sea Turtle
Click to select and then place a green sea turtle, the fastest swimming turtle.

Leatherback Sea Turtle
Click to select and then place a leatherback sea turtle, the largest living turtle.

Rockhopper Penguin
Click to select and then place a rockhopper penguin, a small and aggressive species of penguin.

California Sea Lion
Click to select and then place a California sea lion, an intelligent, slender-bodied eared seal. The California sea lion can perform in shows.

Beluga
Click to select and then place a beluga, a common sight in northern oceans. The beluga can perform in shows.

False Killer Whale
Click to select and then place a false killer whale, which is sometimes mistaken for an orca and is also known as a pseudorca. The false killer whale can perform in shows.

Short Finned Pilot Whale
Click to select and then place a short finned pilot whale, a deep-diving cetacean. The short finned pilot whale can perform in shows.

Whale Shark
Click to select and then place a whale shark, the largest fish in the world.

Blacktip Reef Shark
Click to select and then place a blacktip reef shark, a shark that prefers shallower waters.

White Shark
Click to select and then place a white shark, often considered the most dangerous of sharks.

Goblin Shark
Click to select and then place a goblin shark, a denizen of the deeps.

Scalloped Hammerhead
Click to select and then place a scalloped hammerhead, a shark with an unusually-shaped head.

Blue Marlin
Click to select and then place a blue marlin, the world's largest species of billfish.

West Indian Manatee
Click to select and then place a West Indian manatee, a gentle marine herbivore.

Sea Otter
Click to select and then place a sea otter, the smallest marine mammal. The sea otter can perform in shows.

Narwhal
Click to select and then place a narwhal, a whale that may have inspired the legend of the unicorn.

Pacific Walrus
Click to select and then place a Pacific walrus, one of the largest arctic animals. The walrus can perform in shows.

Remora
Click to select and then place a remora, a cleanerfish that helps keep your sharks, dolphins, and turtles clean.

Substrate Pile with Seaweed
Click to select and then place a pile of gravel, shells, and other materials mixed with seaweed.

Substrate Pile with Shellfish
Click to select and then place a pile of shredded gravel, shells, and other materials mixed with shellfish.

Trainer
Click to hire the trainer. Trainers teach show animals how to perform tricks in shows. Show animals are designated by a star on their icon.

Shark Photo Booth
Click to select and then place a shark photo booth, where guests will pay to have a souvenir zoo photo taken.

Touch Pool
Click to select and then place a touch pool, a shallow pool where guests can interact with small aquatic animals.

Marine Gift Cart
Click to select and then place a marine gift cart, where guests can buy marine animal souvenirs.

Blue Whale Hall
Click to select and then place the blue whale hall, an educational exhibit about the largest animal on earth.

Small Grandstand
Click to select and then place the small grandstand, which seats two guests.

Medium Grandstand
Click to select and then place the medium grandstand, which seats four guests.

Large Grandstand
Click to select and then place the large grandstand, ideal seating for animal shows.

Click to select and then place the upgraded small grandstand, ideal seating for animal shows.

Upgraded Medium Grandstand
Click to select and then place the upgraded medium grandstand, ideal seating for animal shows.

Upgraded Large Grandstand
Click to select and then place the upgraded large grandstand, ideal seating for animal shows.

Water Filter
Click to select and then place the water filter. The water filter cleans the water in tanks.
the block of ice with clams

Block of Ice with Clams
Click to select and then place the block of ice with clams. Some animals that eat clams will enjoy this frozen treat.

Seal Prey Dummy
Click to select and then place a seal prey dummy. This artificial seal look-alike will provide hours of entertainment for aggressive marine animals.

Large Ball
Click to select and then place the large ball. This ball is useful in marine animal shows.

Small Ball
Click to select and then place the small ball. This ball is useful in marine animal shows.

Small Ball
Click to select and then place the small ball. This ball is useful in marine animal shows.

Sea Lion Ball
Click to select and then place the sea lion ball. This ball on a trick platform is useful in sea lion shows.

Jar with Fish
Click to select and then place the jar with fish, which sea lions enjoy.

Tether Ball Buoy
Click to select and then place the tether ball buoy, which various marine animals like to use.

Clam Bubbler
Click to select and then place the clam bubbler. Marine animals such as the manta ray enjoy swimming in the bubbles.

Koi
Click to select and then place the koi, a decorative addition to any pond or tank.

Yellowfin Tuna
Click to select and then place the yellowfin tuna, a form of live food used as an enrichment item.

Arctic Cod
Click to select and then place the arctic cod, a form of live food used as an enrichment item.

Kelp Bed
Click to select and then place the kelp bed, which sea otters use as a resting place.

Rock Island
Click to select and then place the rock island, an artificial floating island that certain marine animals can use.

Desert Island
Click to select and then place the desert island, an artificial floating island that certain marine animals can use.

Low Marine Fence
Click to select and then place a low marine fence.

High Marine Fence
Click to select and then place a high marine fence.

Window Marine Fence
Click to select and then place a marine window fence.

Show Fence
Click to select and then place a show fence, an attractive way to enclose show areas.

Acrylic Tank Wall
Click to select and then place an acrylic tank wall.

Opaque Tank Wall
Click to select and then place a opaque tank wall, which can be used to contain aquatic animals.

Marine Show Tank Wall
Click to select and then place a marine show tank wall, which can be used to contain aquatic animals.
the opaque marine show tank wall

Opaque Marine Show Tank Wall
Click to select and then place a opaque marine show tank wall, which can be used to contain aquatic animals.

Click to select and then place a marine themed tank wall, which can be used to contain aquatic animals.
the opaque marine themed tank wall

Opaque Marine Themed Tank Wall
Click to select and then place a opaque marine themed tank wall, which can be used to contain aquatic animals.

Tank Entrance
Click to select and then place a tank entrance, which gives member of your zoo staff a way to enter aquatic animal exhibits.

Tank Portal
Click to select and then place a tank portal, which is an opening between a show tank and an adjacent exhibit tank.

Acrylic Tank Wall with Portal
Click to select and then place an acrylic tank wall with portal.

Fire Coral
Click to select and then place a fire coral, a coral-like cnidarian with nematocysts like a jellyfish.

Feather Star
Click to select and then place a feather star, a nocturnal echinoderm.

Phaeophyta
Click to select and then place a phaeophyta, a type of brown algae.

Click to select and then place a giant green anemone, a filter-feeding marine animal.

Table Coral
Click to select and then place table coral, a type of coral that grows out wide and flat.

Blue Green Coral
Click to select and then place a blue green coral, a type of coral found in tropical waters.

Sea Stars
Click to select and then place a sea star, a small star-shaped echinoderm.

Sea Fan
Click to select and then place a sea fan, a fan-shaped coral colony.

Kelp Forest
Click to select and then place a kelp forest, a collection of tall algae.

Tussac Grass
Click to select and then place tussac grass, a long coastal grass.

Plate Coral
Click to select and then place a plate coral, a type of coral with tendril-like polyps.

Giant Barrel Sponge
Click to select and then place a giant barrel sponge, a large barrel-shaped sponge found in tropical waters.

Click to select and then place a large benthic rock, which is appropriate for benthic biome-based exhibits.

Pirate Donation Box
Click to select and then place a donation box with an pirate theme. Guests won't donate money if they can't find a donation box, so place them all over your zoo.

Pirate Ship
Click to select and then place a pirate ship, a decoration that can be used in water or on land.

Pirate Mast
Click to select and then place a pirate mast, a decoration that can be used in water or on land.

Treasure Chest Bubbler
Click to select and then place a treasure chest bubbler, which can be used as decoration either on land or in water.

Sea Horse Bouncy Ride
Click to select and then place a sea horse bouncy ride, on which small children can sit and bounce.

Marine Fountain
Click to select and then place a marine-themed fountain. Guests appreciate the beauty of a well-placed fountain.

Marine Music Rock
Click to select and then place a marine-themed music rock, which plays music from speakers hidden inside of it.

Nautilus Drinking Fountain
Click to select and then place a nautilus drinking fountain for guests to sip from.

Beluga Splash Fountain
Click to select and then place a beluga splash fountain, a cool, wet source of amusement for children.

Lighthouse Gazebo
Click to select and then place a lighthouse gazebo, which offers shade and seating for guests.

Click to select and then place an aquarium containing a fascinating octopus.

Click to select and then place an aquarium containing beautiful jellyfish.

Click to select and then place an aquarium containing playful sea horses.

Click to select and then place an aquarium containing colorful tropical fish.

Marine Statue
Click to select and then place the marine statue, which portrays a family of frisky sea otters.

Marine Training Statue

Marine Arch
Click to select and then place a marine arch formed by a pair of graceful dolphins.

Big Screen TV
Click to select and then place a big screen TV, which gives your guests a great view of animal shows.

Marine Path
Click to select and then place sections of marine path.

Show Platform
Click to select and then place the show platform. The show platform is required for running aquatic animal shows.

Training Area
Click to select and then place the training area. The training area is required for training marine animals to perform tricks.
